747ed068-4c5b-46db-9113-5ccc892dc39f.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated a basic understanding of cellular network principles. They have knowledge of the main technology drivers behind the design of cellular networks, the key features of the radio environment, and the techniques used to minimise errors and to facilitate mobility. They have demonstrated knowledge of the evolution of mobile technologies within the 3GPP (GSM) family of technologies.
747ed068-4c5b-46db-9113-5ccc892dc39f.name: Principles of Mobile Cellular Networks

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

They have shown a clear grasp of both radio and network aspects, and how they fit together in order to support the end-to-end services. They understand how cellular principles are applied to third generation technologies, and the underlying techniques that are used.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

Overall, they understand how cellular principles are applied to fifth generation technologies, and the underlying techniques that are used.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

Earners will be able to identify and explain the 5G "use cases" and give examples for each.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

2d11307c-ef42-492a-b39c-c31c30644247.name: Introduction to 5G

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

20533398-9fb4-4f95-9c99-9c1218797593.description: Earners of this badge have shown they understand the various type of LTE UE and their behaviour in the access network. In addition they will be able to discuss location management in the access network.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

They will be explain why OFDMA is prefered for wideband systems and list the benefits and challenges. the can describe the nature of orthogonality in the time and frequency domains. They will also be able to draw the resource grid for LTE highlighting the resource blocks, resource elements and show how resources can be used to map signalling and data.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

They have a grasp of the definitions of next generation performance and can compare 4G and 5G domains and highlight the challenges and solutions of evolving between the two. Earners can also provide a high-level description of the New Radio (NR), acknowledge the challenges of millimeter wave spectrum and discuss the dynamic nature of the NR physical layer.
36f75a0e-2107-4b0d-8e02-2d0e8ec30e2f.name: Introduction to 5G

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved at least 90% in a final assessment at the end of the course.

The will be able to describe the concepts behind the EPS bearer and describe the QoS attribute for dedicated and default bearers. The will also be able to discuss the support for services such as VOLTE and CSFB.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

b104a7b4-61ab-478e-bf3d-fce62b540977.name: LTE Release 9 and Beyond

In addition they will be able to explain the essential aspects of network security for 5G.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

Earners understand how important compliance is and methods for device activation. They are aware of how the technology is evolving to satisfy consumer device capabilities including Dual SIM and cost constraints of IoT applications.
1ce9ce86-e77c-46ee-9115-24006230eff4.name: Introduction to eSIM

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved at least 90% in a final assessment at the end of the course.

75c669dd-f5d8-4981-ac40-97688f74d095.description: Badge earners have built a general understanding of the 5G market place. This includes the main stakeholders, Industry timelines and role-out schedules, 5G's role in the wider world of connectivity, forecast and growth predictions, and potential value creation. They understand key drivers of strategy, including the role of partnerships and ecosystems, and the requirement / opportunity of supporting Industry 4.0 (a wide range of sectors), and Connected Innovation in general.
75c669dd-f5d8-4981-ac40-97688f74d095.name: How is the 5G Market Developing?

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 80% or above in an end of module assessment.

skills.name: 5G In The Wider World Of Connectivity

b0bcbf58-dd00-44e9-8a13-b630bf69c45b.description: Badge earners have completed a course of study and built an appreciation of 5G technology, services and markets. They understand the role and development principles of 5G; the way in which the 5G New Radio works (from a tech-light perspective; and the 5G infrastructure including both the Core Network and Radio Access Network (again tech-light). They appreciate how the 5G market is developing and set to support both existing business models, and a range of new business models / use cases.
b0bcbf58-dd00-44e9-8a13-b630bf69c45b.name: 5G Technologies, Services and Markets

85c4e57e-984d-416c-9771-b03ab4f549f5.description: Earners of this badge have built a "tech-light" understanding of the key 5G mechanisms - focusing primarily on the way in which the 5G New Radio works. They have considered spectrum, bandwidth, modulation techniques, frequency use (including millimetre wave), use of antenna arrays, and OFDMA. They understand the coverage / capacity trade off at the heart of 5G spectrum use.
85c4e57e-984d-416c-9771-b03ab4f549f5.name: How Does 5G Work?

d3128fc9-7bda-4cba-9b45-fb77cfcf79d6.name: What Does a 5G Network Look Like?

They can commentate on the QoS Flow attributes and give examples of services that will use QoS flow attributes. They will also be able to show how the 5G core is able to support non-IP sessions.

They will also be able to explain the architecture of the gNb and how it applies to the concept of RAN centralisation and show consideration of the backhaul network requirements.

Earners will also be able to explain the multiframe concept used for both GSM and GPRS.
2219c883-4eec-485d-bf16-969b02c1f9da.name: Layer 1 Characteristics

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

5b0f5512-2ce7-4dba-a65d-edce373b8e54.description: Earners of this badge will be able to describe the purpose and operations of layer 2 in the GSM protocol stack. They can describe the different types of L2 frame and show how they are used to support mobile to BTS communications.
5b0f5512-2ce7-4dba-a65d-edce373b8e54.name: Layer 2 Signalling

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

8be35094-04e5-47a8-a9ed-c8e3cea4ca8b.description: Badge holders will be able to describe the 3GPP defined data services including the Short Data Service, file distribution, data streaming and remote control and how they apply to FRMCS.
8be35094-04e5-47a8-a9ed-c8e3cea4ca8b.name: Mission Critical Data

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

4350980e-4351-4757-9bb5-e9e82401b2b5.description: The badge holder will be able to describe the additional functionality required in a 4G or 5G network to support mission critical communications using a push to talk mechanism. They will be able to describe the functional components, identities and security features. In addition badge holders will be able to describe the operation of MCPTT.
4350980e-4351-4757-9bb5-e9e82401b2b5.name: Mission Critical Push to Talk

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

The mobility of the radio is controlled through radio reselection procedures which can be described by the holder of this badge. Additionally the holder can describe how a connection is maintained between the radio and network during a call through various handover procedures
8922657f-7e7e-42f9-b232-830c7fc894ac.name: Network Access

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

They will be able to explain the NFV architecture elements, discuss the details of the virtualization infrastructure, VNF elasticity, NFV Management and Orchestration, NFV data models and the role of SDN in supporting NFV.
56cbe188-ffdf-407c-aa83-f5a781324758.name: NFV Engineering Training Course

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge attended the certified Wray Castle NFV Engineering course.

3e65b322-2d31-45a3-8e7c-b85760b7c6e1.name: On-Board System Architecture

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

c4c4958a-f84d-4eca-bdb1-120cc21ba745.description: Holders of this badge are able to clearly describe the limitations of the existing GSM-R spectrum. They will also be able to describe the spectrum requirements should a 4G or 5G technology be used to replace GSM-R. Additionally holders will be able to describe the issues of sharing radio spectrum with other stakeholders.
c4c4958a-f84d-4eca-bdb1-120cc21ba745.name: Spectrum Issues

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

ed068b61-81c6-44dc-8085-dec18ad093cd.description: Earners of this badge will have gained a detailed understanding of the TETRA Air Interface – from the Physical Layer through to the Network Layer. This will include an understanding of the air interface structure, physical and logical channels, channel coding procedures (block and convolutional coding), basic and advanced data links, cell selection and reselection, mobility management, trunking options, and encryption and authentication. They will also gain an overview of DMO operation.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge attended the two-day Wray Castle training course on TETRA Air Interface.

2abb3f65-30f8-4d7e-93f9-ab8169161166.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated a sound understanding of the future of the eSIM. They will be able to comment on the idea of an eSIM application spectrum and talk about the possibility of a unified eSIM specification. they will also be able to explain the concept of the multiple root discovery service and describe the future discovery architecture as well as the GSMA eSIM project.
2abb3f65-30f8-4d7e-93f9-ab8169161166.name: The Future of eSIM

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of course assessment.

f6cd9b54-870a-4a33-96eb-6e3d12a059dc.description: in this course the learners have covered the procedures for Network Access Security and Domain Based Security, they can describe the procedures related to the authentication and key management in the 5G network. In addition they will be able to explain the interfaces and procedures used for communication between 5G SBA Domains.
f6cd9b54-870a-4a33-96eb-6e3d12a059dc.name: 5G Access Security and Service Based Architecture Domain Security

badge_template_activities.title: The badge holder achieved a 75% pass mark to earn this badge.

skills.name: Service Based Architecture Domain Security Architecture

74dd7aff-6b8f-4849-b1c9-21d8eb274aaf.description: Bange-earners have developed a good grounding in the main 5G architectural and practical deployment issues needed to be considered when applying security to the 5G network. They have explored the architectural principles on which 5G is built, as well as the new techniques that 5G brings to cellular systems as part of its enhanced functionality.
74dd7aff-6b8f-4849-b1c9-21d8eb274aaf.name: 5G Architecture and the Service Based Interface

badge_template_activities.title: The badge holder achieved a 90% pass mark to earn this badge.

ad8c44b2-38c7-4dec-bd23-ddda3066c4d4.description: Holders of this badge will be able to demonstrate a clear understanding of the principles of planning radio coverage for a 5G cellular network. They will be able to plan link budgets for downlink and uplink operations for the various frequency bands that may be used for 5G. In addition to planning radio coverage, badge holders will be able to plan capacity for the cells and determine backhaul capacity requirements. A knowledge of 5G parameters will also have been gained by the badge holder.
ad8c44b2-38c7-4dec-bd23-ddda3066c4d4.name: 5G Cell Planning Training Course

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge attended the certified Wray Castle 5G Cell Planning course.

92554b3f-dbda-42c6-863f-993e3cb0b0de.description: Badge-earners have developed an in-depth understanding of 5G security. This includes the architecture, domain security, authentication, key agreement, ciphering, integrity protection, identity concealment, 5G/4G security interworking (incl. dual connectivity) and mapping, mobility (handovers), and security procedures. They understand both the mechanisms and rationale of the various 5G security features, and how they build on the existing 3GPP security architecture.
92554b3f-dbda-42c6-863f-993e3cb0b0de.name: 5G Security Architecture and Authentication and Key Agreement

badge_template_activities.title: The badge holder achieved a 90% pass mark to earn this badge.

6ea64e42-cb83-4c22-b2c7-d0cc1fa5d674.description: Badge-earners have developed a technical overview of the security environment employed within 5G networks. They understand the security protocols employed by advanced cellular networks and the security architecture and processes that provide the new 5G security features (compared to previous generations). This includes 5GNR/LTE Dual Connectivity, distributed gNB architectures, tight integration with Non-3GPP Access, and the new Service Based Interfaces used within the 5G Core.
6ea64e42-cb83-4c22-b2c7-d0cc1fa5d674.name: 5G Security Training Course

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge attended the certified Wray Castle 5G Security course.

d057f761-653e-4c7d-88f7-6b6eb9bde6f2.description: Earners of this badge will have gained an understanding of the requirements for setting availability, performance and reliability objectives for fixed link radio transmission systems. They will appreciate the origin of these objectives and why they have needed to change as transmission systems moved from PDH, to SDH and to Ethernet radio. They will have demonstrated the ability to calculate objectives and identified the potential causes of system outages.
d057f761-653e-4c7d-88f7-6b6eb9bde6f2.name: Availability, Performance and Reliability Objectives

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 80% or above in an end of module assessment.

af94b1a2-6d61-4294-b36c-3050bb527a4a.description: The badge holder will be able to describe the concept train supervision performed by the on-board ERTMS equipment. They will also be able to describe the various operational levels of ETCS and how transitions between those levels may be achieved.
af94b1a2-6d61-4294-b36c-3050bb527a4a.name: Basic System Description

badge_template_activities.title: The holder of this badge demonstrated a thorough understanding of this module by completing a multiple choice assessment where the pass mark is set at 90%

7b9c021d-6139-49ed-8322-05006b75ea80.description: Earners of this badge will have an understanding of the advantages and disadvantages of space, frequency, polarisation, time and angle diversity. They will have demonstrated the ability to calculate optimum antenna spacing, and predict the outage probability, for a space diversity system. They will also understand how to predict the outage probability for a frequency diversity system. They will have also gained an appreciation of diversity combiners, hybrid diversity, and diversity gain.
7b9c021d-6139-49ed-8322-05006b75ea80.name: Diversity Systems

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 80% or above in an end of module assessment.

add312ba-f2be-47e6-9962-ec99d10db444.description: This badge is awarded to those that have successfully completed the ERTMS/ETCS for Radio Engineers training course. Successful participants have a clear understanding of the requirements of the ETCS signalling system used on railways and how ETCS signalling messages can be carried by a circuit switched GSM-R network or over packet switched GPRS. Badge holders will have a clear understanding of the features of GSM-R and GPRS that will be required for the reliable delivery of ETCS signalling.
add312ba-f2be-47e6-9962-ec99d10db444.name: ERTMS/ETCS for Radio Engineers

badge_template_activities.title: The training was achieved by following a series of modules.  Each module was then assessed using multiple choice questions.  The pass mark was set at 90%.
Badge holders followed a series of training modules on-line using self paced learning.

23ebd0df-ada7-47fa-8def-a4dff057e0c7.description: This badge is awarded to those that can demonstrate a clear understanding of the ERTMS 'Language' or protocols used in ETCS signalling. The messages studied include telegrams transmitted by balises and Euroradio messages.
23ebd0df-ada7-47fa-8def-a4dff057e0c7.name: ERTMS/ETCS Protocols

badge_template_activities.title: The badge is awarded on successful completion of this training module and a course assessment with a pass mark set at 90%

9f369572-5c4a-4b08-a78f-f0ada90d2c91.description: The holder of this badge is able to describe the Operating Modes of the ERTMS system from the train drivers perspective. This modules serves as background information for the GSM-R radio engineer.
9f369572-5c4a-4b08-a78f-f0ada90d2c91.name: ERTMS Operating Modes

badge_template_activities.title: The badge is awarded after completion of an on line training module and multiple choice test where the pass mark is set at 90%

327d7932-674c-4cf8-b5ad-e06b13836753.description: The badge holder is able to describe the ERTMS concept and the rational for its use across Europe. Additionally the holder is able to list the key players in the ERTMS industry. Knowledge about the ERTMS standards and legislation can also be demonstrated.
327d7932-674c-4cf8-b5ad-e06b13836753.name: ERTMS Standards and Legislation

badge_template_activities.title: The badge for this module was earned by passing a multiple choice test where the  was set at 90%

fc403700-c2ba-46ed-8cc3-e6b46baed46b.description: Earners of this badge will understand how rainfall, diffraction, and anomalous propagation can cause flat fading, and how multipath propagation can cause both flat and selective/dispersive fading. They will have demonstrated the ability to apply the relevant ITU-R models to calculate rainfall fade depth, and the probability of experiencing flat and selective fading due to multipath propagation, and related both of these to assess whether link availability requirements have been met.
fc403700-c2ba-46ed-8cc3-e6b46baed46b.name: Fading

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 80% or above in an end of module assessment.

caa3e69b-2ae8-412f-805d-d3910a52393a.description: Earners of this badge will appreciate that antennas and feeders selection are extremely important components of designing any radio system, and the importance of best practice installation procedures. They will understand the concepts of antenna gain, front-to-back ratio, antenna beamwidth, antenna bandwidth, cross polar discrimination, and be able to interpret antenna radiation pattern envelopes. They will also understand the need for high and ultra-high performance antennas.
caa3e69b-2ae8-412f-805d-d3910a52393a.name: Feeders and Antennas

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 80% or above in an end of module assessment.

They will understand the importance of optimising the efficient and effective management of spectrum resources whilst also minimising the likelihood of causing interference. They will understand the concepts of wanted to unwanted ratio and net filter discrimination (NFD), and how they are calculated. They will also understand the reasoning behind High/Low site planning.
c26d2e29-d6c6-4d71-98eb-8d4f3f972f68.name: Frequency Assignment and Interference Management

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 80% or above in an end of module assessment.

Holders can describe the limitations of the existing GSM-R system in terms of the technology and available radio spectrum. They are also able to describe the benefits of replacing GSM-R with a 4G or 5G system and how the existing standards may need to be adapted to support railway applications.
22c03b7b-36df-4a04-83c3-c6e572184dff.name: FRMCS - Future Railway Mobile Communications System

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of course assessment.

With the introduction of ETCS in many railway networks the badge holder can demonstrate how circuit switch GSM-R competes with GPRS as a bearer for signalling

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge the holder has completed ten modules, each of which was individually assessed.  A final exam was completed on all ten sections where a score of 90% was achieved.

17dec8f9-92ce-4f23-9726-a56d822bd8e8.name: Introduction to GSM and GSM-R Networks

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

c919d6b9-f0b3-44d4-9e4f-a9e368509294.name: IP Engineering Training Course

63765e01-21a8-41ae-9ba6-d0a83e75fdc0.name: Layer 3 Signalling

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

They understand both Online and Offline charging; Session-based and Event-based charging; and Bearer-level and Flow-based charging. They have also developed their understanding of the way in which connectivity is managed within the network through Policy and Charging Control and the relevant interactions within the overall Billing Architecture.
11892bbf-6701-48a5-b837-f634056322bf.name: LTE Billing and Charging Training Course

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge attended the Wray Castle LTE Billing and Charging  course.

29351cda-5444-43d1-bc46-bfc7ff0a4ce1.name: Mission Critical Video

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

Additionally badge holders will be able to describe the concept of the Integrated Access and Backhaul (IAB)
73a533f3-8579-4891-bc56-fccc1d7b0953.name: O-RAN, O-RAN Operations and Maintenance

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

483455b5-fe85-4abc-bd19-c08934b9f09f.description: Earners of this badge will have demonstrated the ability to successfully plot a link profile utilising their understanding of atmospheric refraction, the k Factor, super-refraction, sub-refraction, ducting, Fresnel zones and diffraction loss - along with the relevant associated clearance criteria. They will have also demonstrated the ability to identify potential reflection areas and apply techniques to mitigate against potential harmful reflections.
483455b5-fe85-4abc-bd19-c08934b9f09f.name: Path Profiling

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 80% or above in an end of module assessment.

b5df5074-c084-49fc-a7f3-b101f7a670ce.description: Earners of this badge will have gained the ability to calculate a fixed radio link power budget, demonstrating their knowledge of EIRP, Free Space Loss (FSL), obstruction loss and atmospheric absorption loss in the process. An understanding of the relationship between bit rate, modulation scheme, channel bandwidth, noise and interference levels, and receiver sensitivity will also have been gained. They will also understand the concepts of fade margin, enhancement margin, and receiver overload.
b5df5074-c084-49fc-a7f3-b101f7a670ce.name: Power Budgets

In addition radio network design and interference requirements can also be discussed.
af533459-0e0c-4bca-b1d4-dd61d2a5be04.name: Radio Network Optimization

badge_template_activities.title: Badge holder will have passed a multiple choice test gaining a minimum of 90%.

1070c8de-e831-4ca0-ba43-c755f06be067.description: Badge-earners have developed a solid understanding of the security mechanisms used within the Service Based Architecture - and hence the 5G Core Network. 1070c8de-e831-4ca0-ba43-c755f06be067.name: Security and the Service Based Interface (including SEPP)

badge_template_activities.title: The badge holder achieved a 90% pass mark to earn this badge.

a39d50f5-b34e-45bf-a07f-11f88fb7aca8.description: Earners of this badge will have demonstrated an appreciation of the need for International, Regional and National spectrum management authorities, and standards bodies, and the essential role they play in the link planning process. a39d50f5-b34e-45bf-a07f-11f88fb7aca8.name: Spectrum Management

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 80% or above in an end of module assessment.

Fixed Link Radio Band and Channel Plans

1cddccf2-6d1e-479d-91c7-961a3fc833b8.description: This badge was awarded to those that have demonstrated a clear understanding of the ERTMS equipment required to support ETCS signalling. Additionally the badge holder will be able to describe basic railway signalling concepts and an understanding of the inaccuracies of odometry equipment.
1cddccf2-6d1e-479d-91c7-961a3fc833b8.name: System Architecture

badge_template_activities.title: This badge is awarded after passing a multiple choice assessment where the pass mark is set at 90%

They will understand the services that TETRA can support and gain an appreciation of the Air Interface and associated radio procedures. They will also appreciate the many ways a TETRA network may be designed and configured, including fleet mapping, network capacity requirements and security parameters. In addition, they will understand the benefits and limitations of DMO.
3fdea920-f78f-40b7-83a5-383fddae0495.name: TETRA System Overview Training Course

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge attended Wray Castle's two-day TETRA System Overview course.

acc49791-f109-4634-8d3f-72ec583e9359.description: To be able to assess the performance of GPRS to carry ETCS signalling a detailed understanding of the GPRS Air Interface is required. acc49791-f109-4634-8d3f-72ec583e9359.name: The GPRS Air Interface

43452feb-2611-404a-b0d0-9d9220a6bfa8.name: The IP Multimedia Subsystem

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

5972b15a-5254-4d7a-9b9b-23f41dc864eb.description: The holder of this badge will be able to describe all of the protocols necessary to carry traffic through a GPRS network. 5972b15a-5254-4d7a-9b9b-23f41dc864eb.name: Transmission Through the Network

badge_template_activities.title: Badge holders will have passed a multiple choice test gaining a mak of 90% or greater.

bcd371bf-34b3-4ced-b986-5ff196d0d70b.name: Whitebox Basestations

ba9c1976-4ca1-4d62-8d3b-fccb709a520d.name: [1] A Need for Radio

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

61e07e9b-6823-458d-840f-18e767e1b00b.description: Earners of this badge are able to explain the characteristics of simple sinusoidal waveforms and more complex waveforms, such as that created by the human voice. They will also appreciate the concepts of time and frequency domain representation of baseband signals, and therefore the bandwidth requirements of analogue and digital signals. An appreciation of analogue to digital conversion techniques will have also been gained.
61e07e9b-6823-458d-840f-18e767e1b00b.name: [2] Frequency and Bandwidth

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

f91b8c1e-f7c5-442c-a819-af4a1f55cb82.description: Earners of this badge will have gained an appreciation of the basic functions of radio transmitters and receivers, and the need for modulation. They will also appreciate the characteristics and differences of AM and FM analogue modulation schemes, as well as digital modulation techniques such as ASK, FSK and PSK. They will understand why different modulated radio signals require different channel bandwidths, and the importance of spectral masks.
f91b8c1e-f7c5-442c-a819-af4a1f55cb82.name: [3] Modulation

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

16d42922-9169-483a-ac54-78cf1029553b.description: Earners of this badge will have demonstrated an appreciation of the need for International, Regional and National spectrum management authorities and the essential role they play in the world of radio engineering. They will have also gained an insight into the invaluable resources that can be obtained from these authorities and the processes involved in spectrum allocation, allotment and assignment.
16d42922-9169-483a-ac54-78cf1029553b.name: [4] Radio Spectrum

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

adfc3a87-bf78-4117-b0f3-d800d09ccd51.description: Earners of this badge will appreciate that antennas and transmission lines are extremely important components of any radio system. They will understand the concepts of the isotropic radiator, the inverse square law, antenna gain, antenna radiation patterns and Equivalent Isotropic Radiated Power (EIRP). They will also have gained an appreciation of the range of practical antennas utilised in radio systems.
adfc3a87-bf78-4117-b0f3-d800d09ccd51.name: [5] Antennas and Transmission Lines

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

9ed59abf-e6ba-430a-9e16-d5a288e60fa0.description: Those who have completed this course have learned about the evolution of 5G and can give examples of 5G use cases and describe the performance attributes required for each. They have also learnt about the basic network architecture and are able to explain the meaning of "service based" architecture and give examples of the core network functions that are required in the 5G core.
9ed59abf-e6ba-430a-9e16-d5a288e60fa0.name: 5G Introduction and Deployment Options

badge_template_activities.title: The badge holder achieved a 90% pass mark to earn this badge.

3e93fe40-02e8-4c57-bc75-2fae9a470603.description: Badge-earners have built a solid understanding of 5G network slicing and topics that impact and drive slice strategy. They have explored Service and Industry requirements, Use Cases and Performance Objectives and the relevance to slice provision. They have developed a good understanding of the technical aspects of 5G slice operation; the use of slice templates and associated attributes; and practical slice deployment and management options – with examples.
3e93fe40-02e8-4c57-bc75-2fae9a470603.name: 5G Network Slicing Training Course

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge attended the 5G Network Slicing course.

26ea01bb-00c9-4932-a0d1-a39a28afc84d.description: This badge has been awarded for the successful completion of the 5G Radio Access Network course. The badge holder has undertaken a comprehensive study of the RAN used in 5G and is able to describe its architecture, interfaces and protocols. Additionally the holder will be able to describe the operational procedures of the 5G RAN as well as the features promised in the next release of the specifications.
26ea01bb-00c9-4932-a0d1-a39a28afc84d.name: 5G Radio Access Network

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of course assessment.

563b6d5e-8392-4e7b-85dd-3f86519b44d2.description: By completing this course learners have covered in detail the 5G Service Based Architecture and Service Based Interfaces. They can describe procedures such as UE registration and PDU session establishment from the SBA/SBI point of view and can show how SBA network functions use the Network Function Registration and Discovery procedures to manage the cloud native aspect of the SBA. Learners can also show they understand SBA security including the security keys and Interfaces.
563b6d5e-8392-4e7b-85dd-3f86519b44d2.name: 5G Service Based Architecture and Core Network

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

9aab85db-5973-4163-8c99-844f762eba4a.description: Badge-earners have built a solid understanding of 4G architecture (as the foundation for evolution to 5G), before focusing squarely on the disaggregated 5G architecture. They have investigated IoT support offered by - NB-IoT & eMTC as part of the overall 4G/5 disaggregated architecture, including the options for 5G mMTC and URLLC IIoT Use Cases. Participants have a solid knowledge of MEC and Private Network deployment issues and options in support of low latency and reliability requirements.
9aab85db-5973-4163-8c99-844f762eba4a.name: 5G solutions Training Course

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge attended the certified Wray Castle 5G solutions course.

62d40837-5028-4eba-aa23-a8d6d74492d8.description: Earners of this badge will have gained an appreciation of how radio waves propagate. They will be aware of surface waves, sky waves and space waves. They will also understand how the ionosphere impacts MF and HF propagation, the layered nature of the ionosphere, and the natural causes of ionisation.
62d40837-5028-4eba-aa23-a8d6d74492d8.name: [6] Propagation

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

dc2ab617-cd14-406e-8e5d-0378a58ab3d2.description: Earners of this badge will have gained an appreciation of the mechanisms that impact VHF, UHF, SHF and EHF radio wave propagation, and hence radio coverage. They will be aware of reflection (specular and diffuse), scattering, diffraction, tropospheric refraction, ducting and absorption. They will also understand that atmospheric pressure, humidity and air temperature impact the degree of tropospheric refraction.
dc2ab617-cd14-406e-8e5d-0378a58ab3d2.name: [7] Radio Coverage

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

8dda1d86-cef5-433b-96c7-d335e5e5ac54.description: Earners of this badge will demonstrate an appreciation of the mechanisms that commonly cause harmful radio interference and the mechanisms that generate noise in a radio channel. They will also understand how careful frequency planning can minimise the likelihood of experiencing co-channel and adjacent channel interference.
8dda1d86-cef5-433b-96c7-d335e5e5ac54.name: [8] Radio Interference

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

3fb7b7b4-ef96-4fd4-8820-64e15637b58b.description: Badge holders will be able to describe the procedures employed when a GSM mobile device is connected to the network. This includes the role of the main signalling channel on the air interface, the measurement procedure, power control, maintaining connectivity through handover mechanisms. The various handover mechanisms and the reasons for why handover mail fail can also be described.
3fb7b7b4-ef96-4fd4-8820-64e15637b58b.name: Circuit Switched Connections

badge_template_activities.title: The badge holder has completed an on line training module assessed by a multiple choice assessment requiring a 90% pass mark

96fef65b-1e5f-4ea5-a45f-73ae3edaaa90.description: Badge holders have demonstrated a clear understanding of the signalling flows between a mobile device and network. These include calls from mobiles, calls to mobiles, security procedures and keeping track of mobile devices.
96fef65b-1e5f-4ea5-a45f-73ae3edaaa90.name: Circuit Switched Signalling

badge_template_activities.title: Badge holders have completed an on line training module and demonstrated a clear understanding of the material by completing a multiple choice assessment.

756f16f0-d794-426f-bd8e-0d384aa0b999.description: Badge-earners have developed a good knowledge of the mechanisms & features used to provide, modify & delete PDN Connectivity Services in the 4G LTE Evolved Packet Core (EPC). This includes EPS Bearer provision, Quality of Service attributes, transport identities, & IP address allocation. They have covered standard & interworking scenarios (with 2G/3G). Both Traffic Flow Templates & Packet Filters have been studied, as well as the role of Policy & Charging - including the PCC & Billing functions.
756f16f0-d794-426f-bd8e-0d384aa0b999.name: Data Transport in the EPC

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 80% or above in an end of module assessment.

0ccd2bb4-7ac1-40d2-8bd1-21cba9db20d8.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated a good understanding of the LTE EPC data transport mechanisms. The will be able to discuss the concept of EPS bearers and explain the properties of the bearers in terms of QCI and APN. They will be able to the process of bearer establishment and maintenance for various connectivity scenarios including PCC rules
0ccd2bb4-7ac1-40d2-8bd1-21cba9db20d8.name: Data Transport in the EPC

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

0eee1750-1a0d-44ad-9382-cd177a67c35d.description: Earners of this badge will be able to discuss the reasons for the need to migrate to virtualization of network functions, explain how technologies including Cloud Computing, Virtual Machines and Hypervisors are enabling NFV, present an overview of NFV requirements and the way in which ETSI has promoted the standardization of NFV.
0eee1750-1a0d-44ad-9382-cd177a67c35d.name: Drivers for Change

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of course assessment.

e076956c-ef87-4db3-9355-c06aee6c9014.description: Earners of this badge have learned a variety of topics important to network engineering. Learners will be able to show how QoS can be applied in IP based networks and give examples of when it might be appropriate to do so. Learners will also be able explain the security risks an IP network might face and discuss some of the techniques that might be used to protect the network. The learners will also be able to discuss the use of VPNs and the techniques used to manage them.
e076956c-ef87-4db3-9355-c06aee6c9014.name: Engineering for IP Application

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

skills.name: Cryptography As Used In IP Networks

7b0d23a5-9087-42d3-9434-fa1d8a0cd359.description: Bange-earners are able to follow & critically analyse EPC (Evolved Packet Core) procedures, & have a good understanding of the overall operation. They understand the Attach & Registration procedures, MME Load Balancing, Idle Mode Functions & Mobility (including Signalling Reduction), & Paging for both data & voice service connectivity (including circuit-switched fall-back). Additionally, Bearers (creation, modification, & deletion), Handovers, Detach, and WiFi Connectivity were covered in depth.
7b0d23a5-9087-42d3-9434-fa1d8a0cd359.name: EPC Operation

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 80% or above in an end of module assessment.

skills.name: Connected Mode Procedures In The EPC
Idle Mode Procedures In The EPC

60657dac-cba8-4cbd-b29a-ec14a5762dd4.description: Earners of this badge have shown an understanding of the operations and procedures of the EPC. They will be able to explain the UE and EPC behaviours during the attach and registration process and how bearers are created and managed. They will also be able to commentate on the connected mode mobility procedures like the handover.
60657dac-cba8-4cbd-b29a-ec14a5762dd4.name: EPC Operation

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

94f7c53e-9f56-44da-b52c-74431d2f7bd2.description: Participants have developed a comprehensive, working, understanding of the 4G Evolved Packet Core Network. This includes the network functions, interfaces, architecture, identities, Tracking Areas, states, security, interworking, roaming, and support for small cells. They understand the options for providing voice services and the key functions needed to support them.
94f7c53e-9f56-44da-b52c-74431d2f7bd2.name: Evolved Packet Core

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 80% or above in an end of module assessment.

8f49183c-7733-47d0-af2b-9bf3ca433c02.description: Earners of this badge have shown a good understanding of the LTE EPC. The will be able to discuss the architecture of the EPC including the core network functions and the interfaces between them. They will be able to explain each of the interface protocols and which interface they apply to as well as commenting on typical operations supported by the EPC.
8f49183c-7733-47d0-af2b-9bf3ca433c02.name: Evolved Packet Core

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

a0f37c12-14c0-4120-bc2b-7841598728e8.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated a good understanding of the Consumer eSIM and can describe the Profile types and states and make reasonable comparison between SIM and eSIM architectures. They can explain the Discovery Service and the role of the Entitlement Server. They will also be able to commentate on the current market state and growth forecasts.
a0f37c12-14c0-4120-bc2b-7841598728e8.name: GSMA Consumer eSIM Specification

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of course assessment.

f6c68454-4949-4ca2-91df-5b9327e8ac05.description: Holders of this badge have a detailed understanding of the GSM Air Interface. They are able to describe the physical characteristics in terms of radio channels, physical channels and logical channels including procedures such as measurements an frequency hopping. Additionally holders can describe the Layer 2 protocol and Layer 3 messages. Holders will also be able to describe the signalling sequences between a mobile device and network for both circuit switched connections and GPRS.
f6c68454-4949-4ca2-91df-5b9327e8ac05.name: GSM Air Interface Training Course

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this certification attended two-day Wray Castle GSM Air Interface course.

75bef4f6-ddc5-4768-9f82-4c758038492a.description: Learners have covered the principles of the HTTP/2 protocol and can explain the advantages of HTTP/2 over HTTP/1.1 and describe why HTTP/2 has been adopted for transport in the 5G core. They will also be able to describe HTTP/2 procedures and describe the HTTP/2 methods used in those procedures.
75bef4f6-ddc5-4768-9f82-4c758038492a.name: HTTP/2

badge_template_activities.title: The badge holder achieved a 90% pass mark to earn this badge.

91d74772-a2e7-45d1-abc5-d1d517d023e7.description: Earners of this badge have shown good knowledge of the origins of 5G and the evolution of cellular radio technologies. They will be able to explain the evolution of mobile technologies from 2G to present day and commentate on the important aspects of each mobile generation. They will also be able to show where to find and how to access essential 3GPP standards for 4G and 5G technologies. Earners will be able to identify and explain the 5G "use cases" and give examples for each.
91d74772-a2e7-45d1-abc5-d1d517d023e7.name: Introduction to 5G

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

9f8180d7-c0bd-4d6c-bd36-a736bed4450f.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated a solid understanding of 4G / LTE network technology and the options available to support voice services. They have a grasp of both the evolved UMTS Terrestrial Radio Access Network (eUTRAN) and the Evolved Packet Core (EPC) - including the relevant interfaces. Earners can provide a description of how end-to-end connectivity is achieved in both the non-roaming, and roaming cases, and understand the mechanisms used to manage Quality of Service.
9f8180d7-c0bd-4d6c-bd36-a736bed4450f.name: Introduction to LTE

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

6e5fb938-fb58-4996-ab7e-beb246c50432.description: Badge-earners have developed a grounding in IoT connectivity and Low Power Wide Area (LPWA) connectivity requirements, including how Sigfox and LoRaWAN support those requirements. They have compared Cellular Machine to Machine (M2M) / IoT to those systems, and developed a good understanding of the benefits of cellular IoT, and in particular, how LTE supports IoT / M2M connectivity.
6e5fb938-fb58-4996-ab7e-beb246c50432.name: Introduction to LTE and the Internet of Things (IoT)

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

53d77330-e152-4f65-831d-a6e404b84e53.description: Earners of this badge attended the Wray Castle Introduction to Radio course. The course provides learners with an appreciation of the key topics associated with radio engineering - including analogue and digital modulation techniques, radio wave propagation and radio coverage, the causes of noise and interference, transmission lines and antennas, and the roles of global, regional and national spectrum management authorities.
53d77330-e152-4f65-831d-a6e404b84e53.name: Introduction to Radio

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of course assessment.

fa2bbc2e-4314-47f7-a13f-6d23d0f8c11a.description: Earners of this badge will be able to discuss the need to evolve traditional router and switch based networking, the migration to SDN, explain the concept of network abstraction and methods of control in SDN, present a simple SDN use case and explain the relationship between SDN and NFV.
fa2bbc2e-4314-47f7-a13f-6d23d0f8c11a.name: Introduction to SDN

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

d1ba1e0b-36eb-409b-bd4b-d0cccd191832.description: Earners of this badge have successfully completed the Level 2 Program IP Engineering. They have shown that they have acquired knowledge and understood topics such as the TCP/IP protocol stack and its operation, routing and routing protocols of various types, they have also shown understanding of the best practice in the architecture of the the Service Provider Domain and how the network may be engineered to provide QoS functions and the basics of network security and protection.
d1ba1e0b-36eb-409b-bd4b-d0cccd191832.name: IP Engineering

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of course assessment.

skills.name: Cryptography As Used In IP Networks
Peering At An Internet Exchange Point (IXPs)

4100558c-1eba-43af-9942-fac226a214a7.description: Earners of this badge will be able to list many of the applications and services which are supported or require the use of TCP/IP. For example they will be able to explain how access network technologies like aDSDL, WiMAX and WiFi might be used to provide access to a user for internet services and how that access may be secured using RADIUS and other methods. Learners will also be able to explain how services such as mail and web services are implemented on IP based networks.
4100558c-1eba-43af-9942-fac226a214a7.name: IP Network Services

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

skills.name: Radio Access Using Public Service Wi-Fi

ffc5f5e4-806a-4d13-a5fe-78de79532b10.description: Earners of this badge have learnt about the origins of the Internet and the development of the protocols that support its function. They have learnt about the TCP/IP protocol stack and can explain the functions of each layer and describe the typical headers used. in addition learners will be able to describe the supplemental protocols such as ARP, ICMP,DNS, IGMP. At this stage learners also have a good idea of the applications that may be transported by the TCP/IP stack
ffc5f5e4-806a-4d13-a5fe-78de79532b10.name: IP Networks Overview

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

3ac07800-739e-4ea3-b628-e6d43f8d8f27.description: Earners of this badge have completed a full LTE Air Interface training course covering 7 topic areas including LTE Overview, OFDM Principles, Physical Layer Structure, Layer 2 Protocols, Radio Resource Control, LTE-Advanced and Lower Layer Procedures
3ac07800-739e-4ea3-b628-e6d43f8d8f27.name: LTE Air Interface Training Course

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this certification attended a Wray Castle two days LTE Air Interface course.

da75fbe8-64b3-4fd6-9732-62a26e379000.description: Holders of this badge have developed a good technical understanding of the Concepts, Architecture, Procedures and Data used in LTE Billing and Charging. They understand both Online and Offline charging; Session-based and Event-based charging; and Bearer-level and Flow-based charging. They have also developed their understanding of the way in which connectivity is managed within the network through Policy and Charging Control and the relevant interactions within the overall Billing Architecture.
da75fbe8-64b3-4fd6-9732-62a26e379000.name: LTE Billing and Charging

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of course assessment.

05c72df3-1bfc-4c23-81af-aefdcb048ae9.description: Holders of this badge have developed a good technical understanding of the Concepts, Architecture, Procedures and Data used in LTE Billing and Charging. They understand both Online and Offline charging; Session-based and Event-based charging; and Bearer-level and Flow-based charging. They have also developed their understanding of the way in which connectivity is managed within the network through Policy and Charging Control and the relevant interactions within the overall Billing Architecture.
05c72df3-1bfc-4c23-81af-aefdcb048ae9.name: LTE Billing and Charging

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of course assessment.

57dcf375-5e5c-429a-9138-29af585fea5a.description: Earners of this badge have successfully completed the full Level 2 LTE Evolved Packet Core training course covering 6 topic areas including LTE Overview, Evolved Packet Core, Data Transport in the EPC, Major Protocols, EPC Operations, Release 9 and Beyond
57dcf375-5e5c-429a-9138-29af585fea5a.name: LTE Evolved Packet Core

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of course assessment.

ff20a42c-a67c-4656-b095-ceec61a57750.description: Earners of this badge have shown they understand the evolution of LTE and can explain the end to end concepts of 4G networks. They will be able to explain the essential architecture of LTE and show how 4G might interwork with PS and CS domains.
ff20a42c-a67c-4656-b095-ceec61a57750.name: LTE Overview

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

ceb17b3e-1a22-4d5c-93b7-181ed4d03206.description: Badge-earners have developed a solid understanding of the features, performance, and operation of [enhanced] Machine Type Communications (eMTC) for LTE in support of machine to machine / IoT. Focusing on the UE (User Equipment) and Air Interface, they understand the features and network optimisations available with Cat 0, and Cat M1 UE, and how they support the required connectivity and performance.
ceb17b3e-1a22-4d5c-93b7-181ed4d03206.name: LTE Technologies for the IoT

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

3b292f66-24a8-4107-9c64-372c7522b002.description: Badge-earners have developed a good understanding of the technical aspects of Machine Type Communication (MTC) for LTE, including an examination of NB-IoT (Narrowband IoT). Areas of study included an overview of IoT and low power networking / connectivity systems; the role and requirements of LTE for MTC; features and performance of the different categories of MTC UE; the Air Interface modifications and features; and the Cellular IoT (C-IoT) enhancements to the Evolved Packet Core (EPC).
3b292f66-24a8-4107-9c64-372c7522b002.name: Machine Type Communications for LTE

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of course assessment.

f595cc7c-3b69-4625-be9c-76919e813bf3.description: Earners of this badge have shown a good understanding of the major protocols used in the EPC. They will be able to discuss the various protocols used throughout the EPC and explain the operation of each. The will be able to explain how QoS is achieved in the lower layers of the protocol stack and how it relates to GTP processes and tunnel management. In additional the earner of the badge will understand the NAS protocols and S1AP protocols
f595cc7c-3b69-4625-be9c-76919e813bf3.name: Major Protocols

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

6a178ed7-c9c7-46e2-8c4a-a3915d16d141.description: Badge-earners have explored the major protocols used within, or associated with, the LTE Evolved Packet Core (EPC). They have developed a deep understanding of both User-Plane and Control-Plane protocols; their formats, options, and the features that they support. Protocols studied include IP-based and 3GPP-specific protocols - namely, SCTP, DiffServ, Diameter, GTP, S1AP, and NAS (Non-Access Stratum).
6a178ed7-c9c7-46e2-8c4a-a3915d16d141.name: Major Protocols

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 80% or above in an end of module assessment.

skills.name: GTP (GPRS Tunneling Protocol) In The EPC

Focusing on the UE (User Equipment) and Air Interface, they understand the deployment options, features and performance of NB-IoT and NB-1 UE (User Equipment). Participants have also developed a good understanding of the cellular IoT (C-IoT) enhancements (features, architecture, and deployment) to the Evolved Packet Core (EPC).
abcf58fe-7de5-40ea-8abe-884188d043e3.name: NB-IoT and IoT Core Network Enhancements

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

0748d1c3-eb07-4d7f-9a6c-5c4c69ecf3c5.description: Badge-earners have developed a solid understanding of the features, performance, and operation of Narrowband IoT (NB-IoT) in support of machine to machine / IoT. Focusing on the UE (User Equipment) and Air Interface, they understand the deployment options, features and performance of NB-IoT and NB-1 UE (User Equipment). Participants have also developed a good understanding of the cellular IoT (C-IoT) enhancements (features, architecture, and deployment) to the Evolved Packet Core (EPC).
0748d1c3-eb07-4d7f-9a6c-5c4c69ecf3c5.name: NB-IoT and IoT Core Network Enhancements

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

0ef3e266-1326-4e06-be38-a59cd5ba6b16.description: Earners of this badge will be able to discuss the reasons for development of NFV, the enabling technologies, NFV requirements, the standardization and open source support for NFV and various use cases and proofs of concept. They will be able to explain the NFV architecture elements, discuss the details of the virtualization infrastructure, VNF elasticity, NFV Management and Orchestration, NFV data models and the role of SDN in supporting NFV.
0ef3e266-1326-4e06-be38-a59cd5ba6b16.name: Network Functions Virtualisation (NFV)

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of course assessment.

2733f018-273a-4aa7-b23c-1b9a91067caa.description: Earners of this badge will be able to explain the purpose of the ETSI Proof of Concept initiative, and explain how key examples in mobile networking and service chaining can be deployed using virtualization and SDN, in each case explaining the benefits of virtualization.
2733f018-273a-4aa7-b23c-1b9a91067caa.name: NFV ETSI Proof of Concept Projects

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of course assessment.

c9a3acef-4523-41c5-8b60-f7f3c9b52fba.description: Earners can present the NFV Architecture, and discuss how key NFV functionality is achieved, including VNF architectures, support for scaling and elasticity, and the way in which Network Services are modelled, covering both virtualized network functions and network links, including the VNF Forwarding Graph. They can discuss the key architectural elements, especially of NFV Management and Orchestration (MANO), along with the functionality supported by the architecture reference interfaces.
c9a3acef-4523-41c5-8b60-f7f3c9b52fba.name: NFV Functional Architecture

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of course assessment.

1572266c-4537-4442-8e98-c6e7fc4947b6.description: Earners of this badge will be able to discuss many details of NFV Infrastructure deployment, including the three NFVI domains – Hypervisor, Compute and Infrastructure Network – along with some of the key technologies underpinning these domains, in particular Containerisation and Hardware optimisation. They will also be able to discuss supporting standardization and open source activities that support management of NFVI, from organisations such as TM Forum and Openstack.
1572266c-4537-4442-8e98-c6e7fc4947b6.name: NFV Infrastructure (NFVI)

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of course assessment.

53427424-2d11-460b-b2e1-42ed226c5799.description: Earners can discuss the NFV MANO architecture and the role of SDN Controllers in realising NFV in practice. They know how Network Services are modelled, and the data relevant for each major component, including the VNF, Virtual Links, Service Flavours, Physical Network Functions, the VNF Forwarding Graph and Connection Points. Finally, can describe the way the NFV MANO Orchestrator uses the data to manage deployment of VNFs onto the NFV Infrastructure, using a 4G IMS MRF as an example.
53427424-2d11-460b-b2e1-42ed226c5799.name: NFV Management and Orchestration (MANO)

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of course assessment.

8647a90a-2a0e-4110-998b-4ec108671b7a.description: Earners of this badge will be able to explain the various NFV Use Cases identified in ETSI standards, including NFV as a Service, VNF FG usage, virtualization of mobile core and access networks, fixed access, content delivery and corporate services, and outline in each case the benefits of virtualization.
8647a90a-2a0e-4110-998b-4ec108671b7a.name: NFV Use Cases

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of course assessment.

1dbc0b51-a336-445d-aa33-a2dde6a40693.description: In this course learners have covered the principles of PDU sessions, covering IP, Ethernet and unstructured PDU sessions. The can explain the principles of QoS as it applies to 5G connectivity. They have also learned about LADN and can describe the operation and required configuration of the 5G network. Interworking with non-3GPP networks has also been covered in this training and the learners can explain various network models including non-Roaming and roaming with HBO and LBO
1dbc0b51-a336-445d-aa33-a2dde6a40693.name: PDU Connectivity Services and PDU Sessions

badge_template_activities.title: The badge holder achieved a 90% pass mark to earn this badge.

33b84650-124d-4a7e-a445-acc3a45eec0e.description: In this course learners have seen in detail the procedures used in the 5G SBA and can describe procedures related to Network Function Service Registration and Discovery, and the purpose of the Service Subscription/Notifications. They will be able to explain the order of operations and signalling events related to UE registration and PDU Session Establishment. Learners will also be able show they understand the migration/evolution from the 4G Core to the SBA and the impact on Mobility Procedures
33b84650-124d-4a7e-a445-acc3a45eec0e.name: Procedures

badge_template_activities.title: The badge holder achieved a 90% pass mark to earn this badge.

cb62c0a1-adda-4dd7-a684-4e478a727a9a.description: This is a Technical Level 2 course conducted over two days and attendees will have a thorough understanding of 2G, 3G, 4G, 5G and Wi-Fi radio systems. This level of understanding will enable the attendee to conduct cellular network radio surveys with the view of verifying coverage and gathering intelligence using survey tools. The attendee will be familiar with a variety of survey tools and understand how they can be used safely and effectively to satisfy a specific objective.
cb62c0a1-adda-4dd7-a684-4e478a727a9a.name: Radio Network Surveys Training Course

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge attended the certified Wray Castle Radio Network Surveys course.

130d0b3e-d2f0-423b-805c-ac8631ec9345.description: Badge-earners have a solid understanding of the incremental development delivered by 3GPP beyond Release 8 (the initial set of standardisation documents that introduced LTE) - specifically as related to the Evolved Packet Core (EPC). They have studied the MBMS (Multimedia Broadcast, Multicast Service), Location-Based Services (LCS), Data Handling Improvements, use of Unlicensed Spectrum, Machine Type Communication (MTC), Access Priorities, Cellular IoT, Dual Connectivity, & Proximity Services.
130d0b3e-d2f0-423b-805c-ac8631ec9345.name: Release 9 and Beyond

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 80% or above in an end of module assessment.

skills.name: Location Based Services In The EPC

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

9fadb004-e08d-4ee0-9071-13b7cec3b17b.description: Earners of this badge will be able to present the SDN Architecture, and discuss how key SDN functionality is achieved, including the Application, Control and Data Plane layers and associated sub-layers. They will also be able to discuss SDN Controller and Switch deployment architectures, and give an overview of available open source SDN components.
9fadb004-e08d-4ee0-9071-13b7cec3b17b.name: SDN Architecture and Standards

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

cb777fae-e937-46a0-bd8a-70ffd3c56b05.description: Earners of this badge will be able to discuss SDN use cases, including SDWN, SoftRAN, vEPC and SDWAN. They will also be able to explain the use of SDN in G-MPLS optical transport networks and Data Centres, as well as present SDNs role in NFV and the deployment of hierarchical and domain controllers. They will also be able to explain key early SDN deployments by Google and China Mobile.
cb777fae-e937-46a0-bd8a-70ffd3c56b05.name: SDN Implementation

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

53aeb946-0d93-4d17-b9da-20fa8eb18925.description: Earners of this badge will be able to present an overview of the various Southbound Interfaces available for use in SDN, including routing protocols, path computation protocols, SNMP as well as native SDN SBIs including OpenFlow and Netconf/YANG. They will be able to discuss OpenFlow messages, flow tables, initialization, pipelines, discovery and configuration.
53aeb946-0d93-4d17-b9da-20fa8eb18925.name: SDN Southbound Operations

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

df47138e-8cee-44eb-ae81-af880fb8c250.description: In this course the learner has covered the basic principles of the Service Based Interface and can explain in detail the services supported by the 5G Core network Functions, AMF, SMF, NSSF, NEF, NRF..... They will also be able to explain the concepts behind the Charging and Service support Functions, BSF, SMSF, NWDAF and CHF. They can also explain the format of the 5G URI used as part of the SBI function communications.
df47138e-8cee-44eb-ae81-af880fb8c250.name: Service Based Interface (SBI)

badge_template_activities.title: The badge holder achieved a 90% pass mark to earn this badge.

1c08d0a0-bfa4-473e-83e9-2a580c589165.description: Earners of this badge have learner the best practice theories of building service provider IP based architectures. They can describe in detail the architecture of the Core, Distribution and Access domains and give examples of the routing mechanisms that might be used throughout the networks. These routing mechanisms include OSPF and BGP4 and the learner will be able to give examples of how they might be applied. Learners can also show the basic operations of MPLS networking.
1c08d0a0-bfa4-473e-83e9-2a580c589165.name: Service Provider Architectures

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

Peering At An Internet Exchange Point (IXPs)

The Core Distribution And Access Model

9d15e715-f7cf-4b3c-a532-3d2719f88139.description: The holder of this badge has studied in detail the signalling procedures in the 5G Radio Access Network. These procedures include mobility management and state transitions. Once a mobile is connected to the RAN its continued connectivity is maintained using a variety of handover procedures. These handover procedures have also been examined in detail.
9d15e715-f7cf-4b3c-a532-3d2719f88139.name: Signalling Procedures in the NG-RAN

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

skills.name: 5G RAN Xn And NG Based Handovers

5db9c5f5-8b3f-467a-b90c-5c3ba437d78b.description: The holder of this badge has studied the four interfaces in the 5G RAN and the protocols used on those interfaces. Each interface has its own set of standardized procedures and the key procedures have been examined in detail.
5db9c5f5-8b3f-467a-b90c-5c3ba437d78b.name: Signalling Protocols in the NG-RAN

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

0398acfb-30f0-48f3-bf08-1b95ccd0e689.description: Holders of this badge will have a comprehensive understanding of the technologies associated with small cells. Holders will be able to describe the role small cells play in 3G, 4G and 5G networks. They will also be able to describe the architecture, interfaces and options for connecting small cell base stations to a mobile network. Additionally, badge holders will be able to describe the importance of Self Organizing Networks (SON) to manage small cells within a mobile network.
0398acfb-30f0-48f3-bf08-1b95ccd0e689.name: Small Cells Engineering Overview Training Course

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge attended the two-day certified Wray Castle Small Cells Engineering Overview course.

dcb27fcd-6e4f-441c-b722-3cf0b886e7ab.description: Earners of this badge will be able to discuss the reasons for migration to Software Defined Networking, the enabling technologies and killer applications. They will be able to explain the NFV SDN concepts, architecture and modelling, SDN southbound and northbound interfaces including OpenFlow operations, as well as discuss some SDN use cases.
dcb27fcd-6e4f-441c-b722-3cf0b886e7ab.name: Software Defined Networking (SDN)

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of course assessment.

ac2ae8f3-5770-4baa-8020-780603a3c0cf.description: Earners of this badge will be able to explain what is meant by Software Defined Networking and how it can be used to support NFV. They will be able to explain the role and functionality of SDN controllers and how they may be driven by management applications, and how they can control Network Equipment over SDN Southbound Interfaces, as well as multi-domain architectures for SDN Controllers, and open source solutions such as OpenFlow and OpenDaylight
ac2ae8f3-5770-4baa-8020-780603a3c0cf.name: Software Defined Networks (SDN) and NFV

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of course assessment.

e8c31754-b2dc-4ad0-8d4e-c8d1df93fdac.description: Earners of this badge will have acquired an understanding of the wide range of technologies used within the converged communications market. They will have explored telecoms concepts and technologies, types of network and services, and how these have evolved - and how they continue to evolve.
e8c31754-b2dc-4ad0-8d4e-c8d1df93fdac.name: Telecoms – Today and Tomorrow Training Course

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge attended the certified Wray Castle Telecoms – Today and Tomorrow course.

2bd48706-9662-4012-8204-67d4cb362a3f.description: Badge holders will be able to describe the characteristics of the 5G Radio Access Network. This includes the base station architecture and the various base station types. Knowledge about multiple antenna technology as applied to 5G can also be demonstrated. Additionally the 5G RAN interfaces can be listed along with the various architecture options and network characteristics.
2bd48706-9662-4012-8204-67d4cb362a3f.name: The Next Generation Radio Access Network

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge achieved 90% or above in an end of module assessment.

1b9af260-1e89-4fae-972b-7688f58b89e0.description: Badge holders have completed a two day intensive study of the UMTS air interface. Holders will be able to describe the aims of the air interface and the use of CDMA. In addition holders will be able to describe the advantages and disadvantages of using CDMA. Holder. will also be able to describe all of the protocols used on the air interface and within the UTRAN. Badge holders will also be able to describe the signalling flows through the UTRAN to support connections and mobility.
1b9af260-1e89-4fae-972b-7688f58b89e0.name: UMTS Air Interface Training Course

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this certification attended two-day Wray Castle UMTS Interface course.
